data.title: Classical And Art Music Traditions
data.meta_description: Misa inglés - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document discusses the development of polyphonic music used in the Catholic Mass between the 12th and 15th centuries. It describes how early polyphonic settings from St Martial in Limoges and Santiago de Compostela involved adding a second melodic voice above plainchant melodies. Over time, the plainchant became more static and took on a supporting role beneath more ornate added voices. The Notre Dame school in Paris further advanced polyphony for the Mass through works by Leoninus and Perotinus that featured two to four voices and sometimes displaced the liturgical music as the main feature of ceremonies. The document then outlines the spread of simpler two-voice polyphonic settings beyond Paris to places like England,
